for_sales.sales_text:
Mark 1 Drifter, No.70, built 1980. Length 6.55m, Beam 2.21m, Draft 0.61m, Weight 1200kg, Sail Area 19.51 sq.m.

Double berth, gas cooker (new 2011), draining sink (new 2019), Lavac marine heads (fitted 2019 with optional discharge to sea or to small holding tank), 100 litre flexible water tank. Rewired 2012 with new switch panels. New sails 2020-2022 with new Profurl furling gear for jib and new forestay.

CQR-type 15lb anchor, with 5m of 6mm (I think) chain and 30m anchorplait warp. 20W solar panel and controller for battery charging. Standard Horizon CP180i chart plotter, Garmin Echo 150 depth sounder/fishfinder, Navico TP1800 tiller pilot

Yamaha 8HP 4-stroke outboard with electric start, just serviced (August 2024). Sprayhood, cockpit cover, engine cover. Boarding ladder. Trailer new in 2010, fully serviced 2021.

A very nice and tidy old boat with lots of new gear. Lovely to potter in or go further afield. I am selling because age tells me a small motor boat is more sensible, but I shall miss her!

Contact me for more information or photos. Available for inspection at St Mawes. Trial sail by arrangement. Reasonable offers considered.
